summary: The Drug Enforcement Administration has recently obligated, on average, over $17 million a year to help state and local agencies eradicate millions of illegal marijuana plants. Agencies in states where marijuana is legal also received funds because illegal growing can occur on national forests or trespassed farm lands. Much of these funds were used for helicopter support and overtime, reflecting long days in remote areas...
title: Illegal Marijuana: Opportunities Exist to Improve Oversight of State and Local Eradication Efforts
